string.text: Multiply Tier1 weight by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier2 weight by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier3 weight by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier4 weight by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier5 weight by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier6 weight by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier7 weight by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier1 price by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier2 price by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier3 price by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier4 price by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier5 price by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier6 price by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tier7 price by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Enables modifying Item weight and price.
Enables modifying the weight and price.
Multiply Relationship gain by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Renown gain by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Influence gain by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Morale gain by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Enables modifying Gold Loss on defeat .
Multiply Gold Loss on defeat by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Enables Overrideing the Clan Model and allows modifying clan variables. Requires Restart
Enables additional Party limit per clan tier .
Additional Party limit per clan tier [Native: 0].
Enables additional Companion limit per clan tier .
Additional Companion limit per clan tier [Native: 0].
Days For Player to Save Workshop From Bankruptcy [Native : 3].
Enable Limit Modifier for workshop limit for player.
Maximum number of workshops for player native is the multiplier number times clan tier [Native : 1].
Enable Number of Levels Per Attribute modifier
Number of Levels to acquire an attribute point [Native : 4].
Enables Focus points per level modifier.
Number of Focus points per level [Native : 1].
Enables Mortality In Labor Chance modifier.
Enables using only harmoney patches and does not load a smithing model.
Multiply Refining Xp by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Smelting Xp by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Smithing Xp by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Disable the energy for crafting and refining tasks [Native : false]
Enable modify the energy used for refining.
Multiply the energy used for refining by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Enable modify the energy used for Crafting.
Multiply the energy used for Crafting by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Enable modify the energy used for Smelting.
Multiply the energy used for Smelting by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Allows for auto locking horses, food , and smithing materials.
Auto lock horses except lame horses.
Disable other cohesion loss except base for armies that are made up of a single clans parties only.
Apply the cohesion multiplier to armies that are made up of a single clans parties only.
Multiply the cohesion loss by this multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Edit killing kandits raises relationships settings.
Number of bandit groups you must destroy before you gain relation.
The base value that your relationship will increase by when it increases.
This is the size of the radius inside which villages and towns will be affected by the relationship increase.
Multiply the Size Bonus by the number of bandits you have killed since you last gained relationship. this will then be multiplied by the base Relationship Increase to give your final increase value.
Enable relationship bonuses only for bandit parties with prisoners.
Enable relationship bonuses for bandit parties.
Enable relationship bonuses for outlaw parties.
Enable relationship bonuses for mafia parties.
Enable Player to use Skill Xp modifiers
Enable Player Clan to use Skill Xp modifiers
Enable AI to use Xp modifiers.
Enable Individual Skill Xp modifiers. Use this or global they don't work at same time
Multiply Athletics skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Bow skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Charm skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Crafting skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Crossbow skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Engineering skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Leadership skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Medicine skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply OneHanded skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Polearm skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Riding skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Roguery skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Scouting skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Steward skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Tactics skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Throwing skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Trade skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply TwoHanded skills exp gains by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Enable Global Skill Xp modifiers. Use this or global they don't work at same time
Multiply skills exp gains by the Global multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Learning Rate by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Party food consumption by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]].
Multiply Food Weight for this morale Bonus by the multiplier
Multiply Food Price for this morale Bonus by the multiplier
Applies the renown, influence and morale modifiers to AI parties.
Shows detailed calculation for renown, influence and morale tweaks in message log.
Changes game behavior inside hideout battles.
Native value is 9 or 10. Changes the maximum troop limit to the set value inside hideout battles. Cannot be higher than 90 because it causes bugs.
Continue Hideout Battle On Player Death
Native value is false. If enabled, you will not automatically lose the hideout battle if you die. Your troops will charge and the boss duel will be disabled.
Native value is false. If enabled, your troops will rush to avenge you and finish everyone off.
Tweaks for siege engine construction speed and collateral casulaties during sieges.
Siege Construction Progress Per Day Amount
This tweak adds a modifier to the construction progress per day for sieges. A smaller number results in longer siege times. [Native : 100%.]
Native value is 0. This tweak adds to the base value (1 or 2 with Crossbow Terror Perk) used to calculate collateral casualties during the campaign map siege stage.
Native value is 0. This tweak adds to the base value (2) used to calculate destruction casualties during the campaign map siege stage.
Tweaks for experience gain of troops in battles and simulations.
Modifies the amount of experience that ALL troops receive during battles (Note: Only troops, not heroes).
Native value is 100%. Modifies the amount of experience that ALL troops receive during fought battles (Note: Only troops, not heroes. Does not apply to simulated battles.).
Modifies the experience gained from simulated battles. This is applied to all fights (including NPC fights) on the campaign map.
Native value is 90%. Provides a multiplier to experience gained from simulated battles. This is applied to all simulated fights on the campaign map.
Allows all weapon types to cut through and hit multiple people.
Allows all two-handed weapon types to cut through and hit multiple people.
Allows all single-handed weapon types to cut through and hit multiple people.
Allows you to set the battle size limit outside of native values. WARNING: Setting this above 1000 can cause performance degradation and crashes.
Sets the limit for number of troops on a battlefield, ignoring what is in Bannerlord Options. WARNING: Will crash if all troops + their horses exceed 2000.
Allows you to change the multiplier for several difficulty settings.
Allows you to change the multiplier for damage the player receives.
Native values: Very Easy: 30%, Easy: 67%, Realistic: 100%. This value is used to calculate the damage player receives.
Allows you to change the damage the player's friends receive.
Native values: Very Easy: 30%, Easy: 67%, Realistic: 100%. This value is used to calculate the damage the player's friends receive.
Allows you to change the multiplier for damage the player's troops receive.
Native values: Very Easy: 30%, Easy: 67%, Realistic: 100%. This value is used to calculate the damage to the player's troops.
Allows you to change the AI combat difficulty.
Native values: Very Easy: 10%, Easy: 32%, Realistic: 96%. This value is used to calculate AI combat difficulty.
Allows you to change the bonus map movement speed multiplier the player receives.
Native values: Very Easy: 10%, Easy: 5%, Realistic: 0%. This value is used to calculate player's map movement speed.
Enables the tweaking of character age behavior.
Native: 3. Must be less than Become Child Age.
Native: 6. Must be less than Become Teenager Age.
Native: 14. Must be less than Hero Comes Of Age.
Native: 18. Must be less than Become Old Age.
Native: 47. Must be less than Max Age.
Changes the values used to calculate how many Attribute and Focus points Heroes gain.
Native value is 4. How many levels you need to gain to receive an attribute point.
Native value is 1. This is the amount of focus points earned per level.
Enable bonuses to the skill experience your hero and companions members gain.
Applies a modifier to the amount of experience recieved for skills. Affects the player only. 100% = No Bonus.
Applies a modifier to the amount of experience recieved for skills. Affects the player only. 100% = No Bonus.
Applies a modifier to the amount of experience recieved for skills. Affects Compaions only. 100% = No Bonus.
Applies a modifier to the amount of experience recieved for skills. Affects the Companion only. 100% = No Bonus.
Modifies the amount of experience recieved for specific skills before applying global experience modifier. Affects the player and companions only. 1.0 = No Bonus. 1.1 = 10%, etc.
Modifies the amount of Engineering experience recieved.
Modifies the amount of Leadership experience recieved.
Modifies the amount of Medicine experience recieved.
Modifies the amount of Riding experience recieved.
Modifies the amount of Roguery experience recieved.
Modifies the amount of Scouting experience recieved.
Modifies the amount of Trade experience recieved.
Modifies the amount of Smithing experience recieved.
Enables several tweaks related to pregnancy behavior.
Disables the chance of children dying when born.
Disables the chance of mothers dying when giving birth.
Allows for adjusting the duration for a pregnancy.
Allows for adjusting the gender ratio of births.
Native value is 51%. Set to 0% to disable female births.
Allows for adjusting the chance of giving birth to twins.
Native value is 3%. Determines the chance of giving birth to twins.
Enabling this will completely override the daily pregnancy check. All settings below will be applied!
Native: disabled. If enabled, the player will not be able to have children.
Native: 18. Minimum age that someone can get pregnant.
Native: 45. Maximum age that someone can get pregnant.
Adds modifier to your clan members to become pregnant. 100% = No Bonus, 200% = 2x chance. Note: May not do much after ~6-8 kids due to the base pregnancy calculations.
Default: 5. Maximum number of children that someone can have.
Sets the base companion limit and the bonus gained per clan tier.
Native value is 1. Sets the bonus to companion limit per clan tier. This value is multiplied by your clan tier. Note that Leadership 'We Pledge Our Swords' perk will also increse this number by 1.

Removes the soft cap on the maximum number of potential companions who can spawn. Native limits the # of wanderers to ~25. This will remove that limit. Note: Requires a new campaign to take effect, as the cap is set when a new game is generated. Credit to Bleinz for his UnlimitedWanderers mod.
Number of weeks between a new companion being added to the world. Set to 0 for a new companion to be added to the taverns every week. [Native: 6]
Changes the number of parties you and ai lords can field and the bonus gained per clan tier.
Changes the base number of parties you can field and the bonus gained per clan tier.
Native value is 1. This is the number of parties you can field at the start.
Clan Parties Bonus Per Clan Tier

Native has a calculation for this: 1 party for under tier 3, 2 parties for under tier 5, 3 parties for over tier 5. This setting is multiplied by your clan tier. A value of 0.5 will equate to 1 extra party per 2 clan tiers, which eqautes to the same as native.
Changes the base number of parties AI Lords can field.
Add to AI Lord Parties Limit
This adds to the the base number of parties AI Lords can field. [Native is 1 for Tier 3 and below, 2 at T4, 3 at T5 and up.] Minor Factions are not included unless the option below is also enabled.
Changes the base number of parties AI Minor Faction Lords can field. [Native is 1-4, depending on Clan tier.]
Changes the base number of parties Custom Spawn lords can field.
Add to Custom Spawn Parties Limit
This adds to the the base number of parties Custom Lords can field. [Native is 1 for Tier 3 and below, 2 at T4, 3 at T5 and up.].
Enables tweaks which affect crafting stamina.
Multiply max crafting stamina by the multiplier [Native: 1.0]
Native value is 5. You gain this amount of crafting stamina per hour.
Native value is 0%. In % of Crafting Stamina Gain. In native, you do not gain crafting stamina if you are not resting inside a settlement.
Native value is false. This disables crafting stamina completely. You will still lose crafting stamina when you craft, but you will still be able to craft when you hit zero.
Enables tweaks which affect smelting of weapons.
Hide Locked Weapons in Smelting Menu
Native value is false. Prevent weapons that you have locked in your inventory from showing up in the smelting list to prevent accidental smelting.
Enable Unlocking Parts From Smelted Weapons
Native value is false. Unlock the parts that a weapon is made of when you smelt it.
Enables tweaks which affect bartering (Marriage, Factions Joining You, etc.)
Adjust the % cost of swaying a faction to join your kingdom. Native value is 100% (no change).
An alternate formula for calculating cost of swaying a faction to join your kingdom, with more emphasis on relationsip. [The higher your relationship to the lord, the cheaper the barter].
Enables tweaks which affect the balancing of kingdoms.
Enables tweaks which affect the balancing of kingdoms in vanilla game.
Balancing strength for vlandia. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for sturgia. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for battania. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for northern empire. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for southern empire. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for western empire. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for aserai. Boosts or reduces the enabled tweaks balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for khuzait. Boosts or reduces the enabled tweaks balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for player kingdom. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing Modifiers For Calradia Expanded Kingdoms
Enables tweaks which affect the balancing of kingdoms in the mod Calradia Expanded Kingdoms.
Balancing strength for nordlings. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for vagir. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for royalist vlandia. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for apolssaly. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for lyrion. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for khergit. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for paleician. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for ariorum. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for calradian empire. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
BBalancing strength for dryatican republic. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for battania. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for cortanian vlandia. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for sturgia. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for khuzait. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for aserai. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for western empire. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Balancing strength for player kingdom. Boosts or reduces the enabled balancing tweaks.
Modifier for max party sizes (1.0 x Balancing Strength).
Modifier for max party limit (1.0 x Balancing Strength).
Modifier for daily production of food goods in villages (1.0 x Balancing Strength).
Flat % bonus chance of new recruits to spawn in settlements (0.75 x Balancing Strength).
Modifier for tax income from prosperity in towns and castles and trade tax income in villages (1.0 x Balancing Strength).
Modifier for troop and garrison wages (1.0 x Balancing Strength).
Increases the chance for upgraded recruits (1.0 x Balancing Strength). No effect if balancing strength is lower than 0% (no decrease in chance for upgrades).
Modifier to how much cohesion should degrade over time. Vanilla is 100%, 0% is disabled.
Armies composed of only clan parties lose no cohesion.
Applies a configured value to your caravan party size.
Native: 30. Be aware that bigger parties are also slower parties.
Applies a bonues to you and AI lord's party size based on leadership and steward skills.
Applies a bonus equal to the set percentage of your leadership skill to your party size.
Applies a bonus equal to the set percentage of your leadership skill to your party size.
Applies a bonus equal to the set percentage of your steward skill to your party size.
Applies a bonus equal to the set percentage of your steward skill to your party size.

The percentage of the party size bonus set for the player to also apply for ai lords. 0% results in no bonus for ai. You may also want to increase food production amounts (Village Production, bigger demand).
Allows you to reduce/increase wages for various groups.
Adjusts party wages to a % of native value. Native is 100%.
Adjusts garrison wages to a % of native value. Native is 100%.
Also Apply Wage Tweaks to Your Faction
Applies the wage modifiers to your clan/faction parties as well.
Also Apply Wage Tweaks to AI Lords
Applies the wage modifiers to ai lord parties as well.
Gives each troop roster (stack) in a party an amount of experience each day based upon the leader's Leadership skill. By default only applies to the player.
The percentage of the leader's Leadership skill to be given as experience to each of their troop rosters. With 100 leadership and a setting of 1000% each troop type stack will get 1.000 xp daily.

The Leadership level required to start giving experience to troop rosters. With this setting at 20, daily training of your troop stacks will start from leadership 20 onwards (but be calculated with the full 20 skillpoints).
Applies the daily troop experience gain to members of the player's clan also.
Applies the daily troop experience gain to all NPC lords.
Displays a message showing the amount of experience granted.
Adds a minimum amount of time before lords can attempt to escape imprisonment.
Whether the tweak should be applied only to prisoners held by the player.
The minimum number of days a lord will remain imprisoned before they can attempt to escape.
Will attempt to detect and release prisoner Heroes who may be bugged and do not respawn. Will trigger 3 days after the Minimum Days of Imprisonment setting.
Enables a % bonus to your party's maximum prisoner size.
Adds a % bonues to your party's maximum prisoner size. Native is 0%.
Wether the prisoner size bonus should apply to AI Lords.
Modifies the conformity rate of the base game, speeding the rate at which prisoners can be recruited.
Adds a % bonues to the conformity generated each hour. Native is 0%.
Apply Prisoner Confirmity Tweaks to Clan
Applies Prisoner Conformity Tweaks to all clan parties as well.
Apply Prisoner Confirmity Tweaks to AI
Applies Prisoner Conformity Tweaks to all parties, including AI lords as well.
Changes the culture of settlement in relation to the owner clan. On deactivation cultures revert back. The last town of a culture will not be changed!
Change To Culture Of Kingdom Faction Instead
Instead of changing the culture to its owner-clan culture, change to its kingdom culture.
Overrides the culture to change to for player clan owned settlements.
After how many weeks the culture of a settlement changes to its owner's culture (and produces recruits of the new culturegroup).
Disables your clan parties from donating troops to clan owned settlements.
Additionally disables your clan parties from donating troops to ANY settlement.
Enables Tweaks for increased productivity in villages.
Modifies the daily production of food goods in villages.
Modifies the daily production of other goods in villages.
Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides for each level.
Native value is 1. Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides at level 1.
Native value is 2. Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides at level 2.
Native value is 3. Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides at level 3.
Changes the amount of food storage the castle granary provides per level.
Native value is 100. Changes the amount of food storage the castle granary provides at level 1.
Native value is 200. Changes the amount of food storage the castle granary provides at level 2.
Native value is 300. Changes the amount of food storage the castle granary provides at level 3.
Changes the amount of food the castle gardens produce per level.
Native value is 5. Changes the amount of food the castle gardens produce at level 1.
Native value is 10. Changes the amount of food the castle gardens produce at level 2.
Native value is 15. Changes the amount of food the castle gardens produce at level 3.
Changes the militia production that the castle militia barracks provides per level.
Native value is 1. Changes the militia production that the castle militia barracks provides at level 1.
Native value is 2. Changes the militia production that the castle militia barracks provides at level 2.
Native value is 3. Changes the militia production that the castle militia barracks provides at level 3.
Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides for each level.
Native value is 30. Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides at level 1.
Native value is 60. Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides at level 2.
Native value is 100. Changes the amount of experience the training fields provides at level 3.
Changes the amount of food storage the town granary provides per level.
Native value is 200. Changes the amount of food storage the town granary provides at level 1.
Native value is 400. Changes the amount of food storage the town granary provides at level 2.
Native value is 600. Changes the amount of food storage the town granary provides at level 3.
Changes the amount of food the town orchards produce per level.
Native value is 10. Changes the amount of food the town orchards produce at level 1.
Native value is 20. Changes the amount of food the town orchards produce at level 2.
Native value is 30. Changes the amount of food the town orchards produce at level 3.
Changes the militia production that the town militia barracks provides per level.
Native value is .5. Changes the militia production that the town militia barracks provides at level 1.
Native value is 1. Changes the militia production that the town militia barracks provides at level 2.
Native value is 1.5. Changes the militia production that the town militia barracks provides at level 3.
Enables tweaks which provide bonuses to food production in towns and castles.
Native value is 100%. Adds a modifier to food production in castles.
Native value is 100%. Adds a modifier to food production in towns.
Allows you to adjust the loss to food production received from settlement prosperity.
Native value is 50. The prosperity of the settlement is divided by this value to calculate the loss. Increasing this value will decrease the amount of food lost.
Grants a flat bonus to militia growth and rate of retirement in towns and castles.
Native value is 0. Adds a flat bonus on how many militia gets recruited each day in castles.
Native value is 0. Adds a flat bonus on how many militia gets recruited each day in towns.
Native value is 2.5%. Modifies the percentage of your militia retiring each day in castles.
Native value is 2.5%. Modifies the percentage of your militia retiring each day in towns.
Native value is 2.5%. Modifies the percentage of your militia retiring each day in villages.
Sets the amount of renown awarded when you win a tournament.
Native value is 3. Increases the amount of renown awarded when you win a tournament.
Adds the set amount of gold to the rewards when you win a tournament.
Native value is 0. Adds the set amount of gold to the rewards when you win a tournament.
Sets the maximum amount of gold that you can bet per round in tournaments.
Native value is 150. Sets the maximum amount of gold that you can bet per round in tournaments.
Overrides the native multiplier value for experience gain in tournaments for hero characters.
Native value is 33%. Sets the modifier applied to experience gained in tournaments by hero characters. 100% = full real-world experience.
Overrides the native multiplier value for experience gain in arena fights for hero characters.
Native value is 6%. Sets the modifier applied to experience gain in arena fights for hero characters. 100% = full real-world experience.
Allows you to set the minimum betting odds in tournaments.
Native: 1.1. The minimum odds for tournament bets, higher means more yield for your bets, if won.
Sets the base maximum number of workshops you can have and the limit increase gained per clan tier.
Native value is 1. Sets the base maximum number of workshops you can have.
Native value is 1. Sets the base maximum number of workshops you can have and the limit increase gained per clan tier.
Sets the base value used to calculate the cost of workshops. Reduce to reduce cost of workshops.
Native value is 10,000. Sets the base value used to calculate the cost of workshops (+ workshop type base cost + 0.5 x town prosperity). Reduce to reduce cost of workshops.
Increases effectivness of workshops by decreasing its daily expenses.
Native value is 100%. Increases effectivness of workshops by decreasing its daily expenses.
Alters the selling prices for products of workshops.
Native value is 100%. Alters the selling prices for products of workshops. Increase for better profits.
Alters the buying prices for input items of workshops.
Native value is 100%. Alters the buying prices for input items of workshops. Decrease for better profits.
Allows Player to Keep Their Workshops When a Kingdom Declares War [Native : false].
Allows Player to Keep Their Workshops on Bankruptcy [Native : false].
When enabled, quest troops such as Borrowed Troop in your party are ignored when party morale is calculated.
Show Number of Days of Food
Changes the number showing how much food you have to instead show how many days' worth of food you have. (Bottom right of campaign map UI).
Sets the campaign speed in fast forward mode. Vanilla is 4.
Multiply Learning limit by the multiplier [Native : 0.0[0%]].
Allows you to change the bonus persuasion chance multiplier the player receives.
Player Persuasion Bonus Chance Tweak Amount
Native values: Very Easy: 0.1%, Easy: 0.05%, Realistic: 0%. This value is used to calculate player's persuasion bonus chance.
Clan Member Death Chance Reduction Tweak
Allows you to change the clan member death chance reduction multiplier.
Clan Member Death Chance Reduction Amount
Native values: Very Easy: 0.1%, Easy: 0.05%, Realistic: 0%. This value is used to calculate Clan member death chance reduction in missions.
Adds a bonus to the chance that militia spawning in towns and castles are elite.
Native value is 10%. Sets the chance that the militia spawning in towns and castles are elite melee troops.
Debug mode - Killing Bandits Raises RelationShips tweaks
Debug mode - Another Chance At marriage tweaks
Enables the another chance at marriage tweaks.
The number of days that has to pass between attempts to restart the courtship. [Native: N/A].
Enables refining formula tweaks which adjust formula cost and output values.
Multiply formula input cost by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]]. at 50% 1 wood = 1 charcoal at 100% 2 wood = 1 charcoal. Minimum resource cost is 1
Multiply formula output result by the multiplier [Native : 1.0[100%]]. at 200% 2 wood = 2 charcoal, 300% 2 wood = 3 charcoal
Enablessetting the base bonus for each of the crafting bonus types, fine, master and legendary.
Set bonus base value for fine quality crafting [Native : 1].
Set bonus base value for master quality crafting [Native : 2].
Set bonus base value for Legendary quality crafting [Native : 3].
Allows you to set the battle size limit outside of native values. Will be dynamically adjusted to actual battle parameters. WARNING: BETA.
Sets the limit for number of troops on a battlefield. May get automatically reduced when a crash is imminent because of a too large battle size limit for a given battle.

Sets the amount of free slots needed in relation to battlesize before reinforcements can spawn. With a Battle Size Limit of 1000 and a set value of 10% --> Min size of reinforcement is 100 (for both sides combined). [Vanilla:10%]

Reserve this amount of slots in relation to Min size of reinforcements value if close to the max slots limit. If this is set to low and you are near the max slot limit of 2048 reinforcements spawn very late or wont spawn fully/at all.
The amount of horses that will stay on the battlefield. Any horses exceeding that amount will flee from the battlefield and free up agent slots.

Vanilla assumes each troop to spawn is mounted (2 agents). We instead get the mounted share in army composition before battle and update it during battle. This value increases that share for safety reasons, because reinforcements dont exactly spawn with initial army composition ratio. Increase if you get crashes.
Increases or decreases the amount battle moral changes when different effects get applied. 0 % results in no battle moral changes at all and will prevent any unit fleeing for example [Native : 100%.]
Enable Unlocking All Parts Fror Smelted Weapons
Enables unlocking all wepaon parts for crafting weapons on next game load.
Enables arrows multipliers for price and stack size
Multiply stack sizes by the multiplier [Native: 1.0(100%)].
Multiply stack sizes by the multiplier [Native: 1.0(100%)].
Multiply stack sizes by the multiplier [Native: 1.0(100%)].
Set the lowest speed allowed for any party, if a parties speed would fall below this it will changed to the limit. [Native: 1.0f]
Enables the new method to reduce a parties speed so long as they are fleeing.
Modify Fleeing parties speed by the specified amount.
Set how many hours between speed reductions
Enables static Kaoses party speed Modifiers
Modify Looters parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Steppe parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Desert parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Mountain parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Forest parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify SeaRaiders parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Caravan parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Elite Caravan parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Villagers parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Player parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Player Clan parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Kingdom parties speed by the specified amount.
Modify Other Kingdom parties speed by the specified amount.
Use harmony patches only for battle reward tweaks. Use for comaptability with other mods.
Enables Harmony Patches instead of model.
Enables faction balancing of kingdoms via hormony patches instead of model.
Multipliers that increase the size of Bandit, Villager, Caravan, and Militias. Tick the box to enable and configure. Restart Required.
Multiply bandit party sizes by this amount.
Multiply villager party Sizes by this amount.
Multiply caravan party Sizes by this amount.
